title: Calories in Oat Cookies
meta_description: Discover calories in oat cookies per serving, including carbs, protein, fat, and nutrition breakdowns for oatmeal varieties.
assumptions: Standard oatmeal cookie (~30 g each), baked with oats, flour, butter, sugar, and cinnamon; no raisins or nuts added.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, brand, size, ingredients, and baking method. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One standard oat cookie provides about 140 kcal, with 18 g carbs and 2 g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

tweaks.label: Include chocolate chips (1 tsp per cookie)

faqs.q: How many calories in one oat cookie?
faqs.a: About 140 kcal for a standard 30 g oatmeal cookie.

faqs.q: Are oat cookies high in fiber?
faqs.a: They provide ~1 g fiber per cookie from oats, aiding digestion.

faqs.q: What's the protein in oat cookies?
faqs.a: Roughly 2 g protein per cookie, mostly from oats.

faqs.q: Do oat cookies have a lot of sugar?
faqs.a: Around 10 g sugars per cookie from added sweeteners.

faqs.q: How do homemade oat cookies compare to store-bought?
faqs.a: Homemade can be lower in sodium (~100 mg) but vary by recipe; store-bought often higher in fats.
